p: Î²-amino acid-containing heterocycles are present in several drugs that act by being either agonists or antagonists of the receptors that respond to neurotransmitters, which are chemical messengers. It is known that the selective agonism of A 3 adenosine receptors is associated with anticancer [ 20], cardioprotective [ 21, 22] and cerebroprotective activity [ 23, 24] while the selective antagonists [ 25] for A 3 adenosine receptors are of potential clinical use for combating inflammation and asthma. Due to this, A 3 adenosine receptors are still promising targets for the development of clinically useful molecules.
